# interfaceLayoutDirection(for:)

**Type Method**

Returns the user interface direction for the given semantic content attribute.

## Declaration

```swift
class func interfaceLayoutDirection(for semanticContentAttribute: WKInterfaceSemanticContentAttribute) -> WKInterfaceLayoutDirection
```

## Parameters

- **semanticContentAttribute**: The semantic content attribute. For a list of possible values, see [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceSemanticContentAttribute].

## Return Value

The user interface layout direction (left-to-right or right-to-left). For a list of possible values, see [doc://com.apple.watchkit/documentation/WatchKit/WKInterfaceLayoutDirection].

## Accessing the Layout Direction

- **layoutDirection**: The layout direction of the user interface.
- **WKInterfaceSemanticContentAttribute**: A semantic description of the view’s contents, used to determine whether the view should be flipped when switching between left-to-right and right-to-left layouts.
- **WKInterfaceLayoutDirection**: Specifies the directional flow of the user interface.
